title.narrative: Access to Education for Children in South Africa

description.narrative:
1) Improve access to quality education in township impoverished areas and establishing formal primary schools and high schools with leadership curricula. This will be done by: Constructing and furnishing movable high quality (education department approved) classrooms and head teachers’ offices; Establishing safe play grounds; Developing feeding areas, toilet and ablution facilities in schools; Renovating and furnishing existing classrooms; Supplying teaching/learning material and text books and stationery for all students; Providing school uniforms and daily meals for all learners; and Training teachers on relevant curriculum.
2) Train one teacher from each of the targeted schools on educational therapy and establish requisite facilities and tools for reintegration of out of school children. This will be done by: Training a number of teachers in educational therapy; and Establishment of educational therapy labs and distribution of tools.
3) Raise awareness of the students, parents, and community members on the importance of education and benefits towards eradicating poverty by developing and caring for the future leaders of South Africa. This will be done by: Conducting the awareness sessions in schools, churches, mosques, and at the community leaders’ places, arranging a national media campaign on the importance of education and the importance of the project and preserving the facilities; Training the schools teachers on communication skills; and Supporting Local Education department offices to conduct systematic periodic monitoring and support supervision of schools.
Improve access to education for 410 children in 3 townships through Leadership Colleges in Kwanothemba, Hyde Park, and Ennerdale
